text: Hello Everyone! I'm a newbie to Julia. Quick question -- so why should I teach Julia instead of Python.. Any thoughts?

text: Maybe try working with Julia before deciding whether to teach it in comparison to Python? That should answer your own question

text:
I think it depends on the class. For more scientifically oriented courses, Julia makes more sense. Direct implementations of mathematics tend to be much more intuitive and easier to understand in Julia than in Python. Julia also has a much better type system (i.e. it actually has a type system...) which is good for becoming a better programmer, imho.

For broader CS topics, though, Python might still be the way to go. It has a much broader range of available packages and frameworks.

text: My rule of thumb is that if you were going to use Matlab to teach a “math tools” class, switch to julia.
